contentPageHeader.summary: Free Trade Agreements are treaties which make trade and investment between two or more economies easier. Find out more here.

content.content: Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) are treaties which make trade and investment between 2 or more economies easier. Singapore has an open economy which is driven by trade in goods and services. Over the years, it has forged an extensive network of 27 implemented agreements.

With FTAs, Singapore-based exporters and investors stand to enjoy a myriad of benefits like tariff concessions, preferential access to certain sectors, faster entry into markets and Intellectual Property protection.
Click here for more information on Free Trade Agreements and Digital Economy Agreements.

cards.title: Singapore-India Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement (CECA)
cards.text: Understanding the comprehensive economic partnership between Singapore and India and why it matters to us.

cards.title: Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
cards.text: The CPTPP is a FTA between 11 countries: Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Canada, Chile, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Peru, Singapore and Vietnam.
cards.imageAlt: Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)

cards.title: FTA Website
cards.text: Visit the FTA website for more information.

cards.title: Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) Agreement
cards.text: The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (“RCEP") Agreement is a Free Trade Agreement (“FTA”) between 15 countries: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Viet Nam, Australia, China, Japan, Republic of Korea, and New Zealand.

cards.title: European Union-Singapore Free Trade Agreement (EUSFTA)
cards.text: The EUSFTA is the first FTA concluded between the EU and an ASEAN country.
